alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 5:40PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTY THROUGH 615 PM MDT... At 540 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over eastern Rio Rancho, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rio Rancho, Corrales, Bernalillo, Enchanted Hills, Mariposa, Cabezon, Coronado State Monument, Vista Hills, Sandia Pueblo and Rio Rancho City Center. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 236 and 242. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 1 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area
